wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I amazed you can't see the problem. The term factory is indelibly linked to economies of scale in our culture. Choosing the title "Software Factories" and expecting his readers to understand the point he was trying to make is an act of overwhelming ignorance or simple stupidity. The closest analogy he makes between physical production and software production is construction. Do you actually think we build bridges in factories? Don't blame the readers when the author fails to communicate his point.
